title: Sourcegraph now indexes all 87k+ Rust Crates
Got made redundant, building a website on my own.. any tips?
text:
I was made redundant earlier this year. Probably for the best as I was stagnating there.

Decided to have a go at starting my own business and making my own website, a music portal.

It's been a fun process so far. Designing, learning, coding, building, getting feedback.

Would like to share the journey a bit so happy to answer any questions.

Keen to hear any tips from others who are doing the same..

title: With Netflix Ad Deal, Microsoft Makes a Splash on Madison Avenue
Show HN: Floode â€“ Inbox 0 for DMs
text:
Hi,

Currently working on Floode. I am a 2nd time founder who ran my sales/networking/fundraising using social media DMs. So we have built a tool that combines all DMs at the same place and make it faster to sort/manage them with shortcuts, to reach inbox 0 as fast as possible.

Would love your feedback!

I think developer portfolios lack text
text:
When I decided to make my portfolio, I started by looking at other developers' portfolios. I saw many fancy websites, with animations and cool visualisations. But one thing always bothered me. Even after viewing the site, I still had no idea who that person was and what their personality was like. I find that a crucial part of a portfolio website. It is important too So when I made my own, I wrote a detailed description for every featured project, some general sentences about me, why I code, how I learn to code, what my ambitions are, and what I am currently working on. On Twitter I got great feedback for this approach. In case you want to take a look at my portfolio, you can find it under:

https://hendel.vercel.app/
